meanings.definition: A small, narrow beam of light or particles.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used microbeams to study tiny particles in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The microbeams of light illuminated the dark room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat chased the microbeams of light around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a collection of microbeams, brightening up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The microbeams danced across the wall, creating a magical display.

meanings.definition: A small, focused beam of electrons used in microscopy.
meanings.sent1: The electron microscope used powerful microbeams to magnify tiny objects.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on microbeams to observe minuscule details in samples.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous electron decided to play hide-and-seek with the microbeams.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a microbeam, focused and unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The microbeams revealed a hidden world invisible to the naked eye.

meanings.definition: A small, concentrated stream of energy used in scientific research.
meanings.sent1: Researchers harnessed powerful microbeams to conduct groundbreaking experiments.
meanings.sent2: The microbeams of energy were crucial in advancing scientific discoveries.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous scientist accidentally spilled the microbeams all over the lab.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm was like a microbeam of energy, propelling the team forward.
meanings.sent5: The microbeams of energy cut through the darkness, revealing new possibilities.
